trans-unit.source: For example, imagine that we have to translate a file containing the following phrase from English to French:
trans-unit.target: For example, imagine that we have to translate a file containing the following phrase from English to French:

trans-unit.source: My house is red.
trans-unit.target: My house is red.

trans-unit.source: {1>In order to translate the file containing this phrase, we created a project for translating from English to French and associated a <1}{2>private TM key <2}and an {3>EN>FR glossary<3}.
trans-unit.target: {1>In order to translate the file containing this phrase, we created a project for translating from English to French and associated a <1}{2>private TM key <2}and an {3>EN>FR glossary<3}.

trans-unit.source: In the glossary, we have the following term and its translation:
trans-unit.target: In the glossary, we have the following term and its translation:

trans-unit.source: Source
trans-unit.target: Source

trans-unit.source: Target
trans-unit.target: Target

trans-unit.source: House
trans-unit.target: House

trans-unit.source: Maison
trans-unit.target: Maison

trans-unit.source: 3 {1>It is not possible to download the translated segment for a specific project yet.<1}
trans-unit.target: 3 {1>It is not possible to download the translated segment for a specific project yet.<1}

trans-unit.source: {1>We plan to devel-op such functionality in one of our next releases.<1}
trans-unit.target: {1>We plan to devel-op such functionality in one of our next releases.<1}

trans-unit.source: 4 {1>Terms are words or set of words of a particular kind of language or branch of study.<1}
trans-unit.target: 4 {1>Terms are words or set of words of a particular kind of language or branch of study.<1}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 22
trans-unit.target: Page 22

trans-unit.source: Opening the phrase for translation, we have no suggestions from our translation memory but we have the translation of “house” in our glossary.
trans-unit.target: Opening the phrase for translation, we have no suggestions from our translation memory but we have the translation of “house” in our glossary.

trans-unit.source: In this case, MateCat suggests how to translate the term “house”.
trans-unit.target: In this case, MateCat suggests how to translate the term “house”.

trans-unit.source: In MateCat, {1>the glossary is included in the <1}{2>private TM key<2}{3> associated with the project.<3}
trans-unit.target: In MateCat, {1>the glossary is included in the <1}{2>private TM key<2}{3> associated with the project.<3}

trans-unit.source: {3>If no private TM key is associated yet, a new one will be created once you insert the first glossary term.<3}
trans-unit.target: {3>If no private TM key is associated yet, a new one will be created once you insert the first glossary term.<3}

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>Note: please refer to the section <2}{3>How to Use Glossary Terms in Your Translated Segment<3}{4> to know how to add a glossary term while translating.<4}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>Note: please refer to the section <2}{3>How to Use Glossary Terms in Your Translated Segment<3}{4> to know how to add a glossary term while translating.<4}

trans-unit.source: {1>CSV <1}is the only supported glossary format.
trans-unit.target: {1>CSV <1}is the only supported glossary format.

trans-unit.source: You just have to upload it to your private TM key.{2>5<2}
trans-unit.target: You just have to upload it to your private TM key.{2>5<2}

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>Why add a glossary for your project?<2}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>Why add a glossary for your project?<2}

trans-unit.source: {3>If you upload a glossary, MateCat also looks up single terms.<3}
trans-unit.target: {3>If you upload a glossary, MateCat also looks up single terms.<3}

trans-unit.source: {3>In the translation memory, this function is performed at <3}{4>segment level<4}{5>, whereas in the glossary it is performed at <5}{6>term level<6}{7>.<7}
trans-unit.target: {3>In the translation memory, this function is performed at <3}{4>segment level<4}{5>, whereas in the glossary it is performed at <5}{6>term level<6}{7>.<7}

trans-unit.source: Translation Editor User Interface
trans-unit.target: Translation Editor User Interface

trans-unit.source: Documents are translated in the {1>Translation Editor <1}window.
trans-unit.target: Documents are translated in the {1>Translation Editor <1}window.

trans-unit.source: This is the translator’s main interface.
trans-unit.target: This is the translator’s main interface.

trans-unit.source: You can access this page:
trans-unit.target: You can access this page:

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}By clicking on the {2>Translate <2}button on the {3>Analysis page<3}
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}By clicking on the {2>Translate <2}button on the {3>Analysis page<3}

trans-unit.source: • {1>directly from the corresponding previously generated/provided <1}{2>job URL<2}
trans-unit.target: • {1>directly from the corresponding previously generated/provided <1}{2>job URL<2}

trans-unit.source: 5 {1>The user cannot upload the glossary by him/herself yet.<1}
trans-unit.target: 5 {1>The user cannot upload the glossary by him/herself yet.<1}

trans-unit.source: {1>We plan to develop such functionality in one of our next releases.<1}
trans-unit.target: {1>We plan to develop such functionality in one of our next releases.<1}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 23
trans-unit.target: Page 23

trans-unit.source: The job URL contains information about the {1>job <1}you are translating.
trans-unit.target: The job URL contains information about the {1>job <1}you are translating.

trans-unit.source: Below, you will find an explanation of the different elements of the URL.
trans-unit.target: Below, you will find an explanation of the different elements of the URL.

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}www.matecat.com – {2>Base URL <2}{3>for the MateCat proprietary version. <3}{4>• <4}/translate – This indicates that you are in the {5>translation editor page<5}{6>. <6}{7>• <7}/Test – The {8>name <8}of the project you are translating.
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}www.matecat.com – {2>Base URL <2}{3>for the MateCat proprietary version. <3}{4>• <4}/translate – This indicates that you are in the {5>translation editor page<5}{6>. <6}{7>• <7}/Test – The {8>name <8}of the project you are translating.

trans-unit.source: • {1>/en-US-it-IT – The <1}{2>language pair <2}{3>of your translation.<3}
trans-unit.target: • {1>/en-US-it-IT – The <1}{2>language pair <2}{3>of your translation.<3}

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}{2>/43505-0d5d8d53c774 – The <2}{3>job ID <3}(43505) followed by the unique {4>job “password” <4}(in this case, 0d5d8d53c774).
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}{2>/43505-0d5d8d53c774 – The <2}{3>job ID <3}(43505) followed by the unique {4>job “password” <4}(in this case, 0d5d8d53c774).

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}#21694626 – The {2>unique identifier of the segment <2}you are translating.
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}#21694626 – The {2>unique identifier of the segment <2}you are translating.

trans-unit.source: This number changes every time you open a new segment.
trans-unit.target: This number changes every time you open a new segment.

trans-unit.source: The {1>Translation Editor User Interface <1}contains only one environment with all the information necessary for the translator to work on the job.
trans-unit.target: The {1>Translation Editor User Interface <1}contains only one environment with all the information necessary for the translator to work on the job.

trans-unit.source: The interface contains the following bars and information:
trans-unit.target: The interface contains the following bars and information:

trans-unit.source: o {1>Top bar<1}
trans-unit.target: o {1>Top bar<1}

trans-unit.target: {1}{2>Click on the logo to go to the <2}{3>homepage <3}{4>of the MateCat tool and create a new project.<4}

trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.target: Page 24

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>The <2}{3>name <3}{4>of the job and <4}{5>language pair <5}{6>combination.<6}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>The <2}{3>name <3}{4>of the job and <4}{5>language pair <5}{6>combination.<6}

trans-unit.target: {6>Click on the arrow to see the list of the files and <6}{7>navigate through them<7}{8>.<8}

trans-unit.target: {1}{2>Click to <2}{3>download the original <3}{4>file(s).<4}

trans-unit.target: {1}{2>Click<2}{j}{2>to<2}{j}{3>download<3}{j}{3>a<3}{j}{3>preview<3}{j}{3>of<3}{j}{3>the translated file(s)<3}{4>.<4}

trans-unit.source: {4>The preview contains your translation and machine translation for the remaining untranslated segments.<4}
trans-unit.target: {4>The preview contains your translation and machine translation for the remaining untranslated segments.<4}

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>The <2}{3>Preview <3}{4>button is replaced by the <4}{5>Download<5}{j}{5>translation<5}{j}{6>button<6}{j}{6>once<6}{j}{6>the translation is<6}{j}{7>complete<7}{j}{8>(<8}{9>100% on the progress bar<9}{10>).<10}

trans-unit.source: {4>Based on the average time spent on the last 10 translated segments, MateCat calculates <4}{5>the hourly turnaround <5}{6>for the job if you are currently working on the translation.<6}
trans-unit.target: {4>Based on the average time spent on the last 10 translated segments, MateCat calculates <4}{5>the hourly turnaround <5}{6>for the job if you are currently working on the translation.<6}

trans-unit.source: {6>After one hour of inactivity, this information is no longer available.<6}
trans-unit.target: {6>After one hour of inactivity, this information is no longer available.<6}

trans-unit.target: {1}{2>The <2}{3>estimated time left to complete <3}{4>the translation.<4}

trans-unit.target: {4>Based on the time spent on the last 10 translated segments, MateCat calculates <4}{5>how much time is needed to complete the translation <5}{6>if you are currently working on the translation.<6}

trans-unit.target: {6>After one hour of inactivity, this information is no longer available.<6}

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>Information about the <2}{3>account you are logged in with<3}{4>.<4}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>Information about the <2}{3>account you are logged in with<3}{4>.<4}

trans-unit.target: {4>Click on login to sign in using Google.<4}

trans-unit.source: Source text and target text are displayed {1>side by side<1}.
trans-unit.target: Source text and target text are displayed {1>side by side<1}.

trans-unit.source: Click on any segment in the target column to open it for translation.
trans-unit.target: Click on any segment in the target column to open it for translation.

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>What if I need to stop translating and switch off my computer?<2}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>What if I need to stop translating and switch off my computer?<2}

trans-unit.source: {3>In MateCat your translation is <3}{4>automatically saved <4}{5>in the document when you edit the segment, and in the translation memory, if any, when you click on the <5}{6>Translated <6}{7>or <7}{8>T+>> <8}{9>buttons.<9}
trans-unit.target: {3>In MateCat your translation is <3}{4>automatically saved <4}{5>in the document when you edit the segment, and in the translation memory, if any, when you click on the <5}{6>Translated <6}{7>or <7}{8>T+>> <8}{9>buttons.<9}

trans-unit.source: {9>If you need to stop translating and switch off your computer, all you need to do is <9}{10>open the <10}{11>job URL <11}{12>again <12}{13>in your browser.<13}
trans-unit.target: {9>If you need to stop translating and switch off your computer, all you need to do is <9}{10>open the <10}{11>job URL <11}{12>again <12}{13>in your browser.<13}

trans-unit.source: {13>MateCat automatically opens the last segment you edited.<13}
trans-unit.target: {13>MateCat automatically opens the last segment you edited.<13}

trans-unit.source: {13>If you created the project yourself, by logging in with your <13}{14>Google account, <14}{15>you can recover the job URL from your <15}{16>Management Panel<16}{17>.<17}
trans-unit.target: {13>If you created the project yourself, by logging in with your <13}{14>Google account, <14}{15>you can recover the job URL from your <15}{16>Management Panel<16}{17>.<17}

trans-unit.source: {17>If you were not logged in during the creation of the project or if you did not create the project by your-self, remember to store the job URL in a safe place in order to recover it again easily.<17}
trans-unit.target: {17>If you were not logged in during the creation of the project or if you did not create the project by your-self, remember to store the job URL in a safe place in order to recover it again easily.<17}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 30
trans-unit.target: Page 30

trans-unit.source: Translation Toolbox
trans-unit.target: Translation Toolbox

trans-unit.source: Manage your language resources
trans-unit.target: Manage your language resources

trans-unit.source: You can store all your private TMs in MateCat and assign them to your projects when creating them or during translation.
trans-unit.target: You can store all your private TMs in MateCat and assign them to your projects when creating them or during translation.

trans-unit.source: {b>Adding a TM to a project<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Adding a TM to a project<b}

trans-unit.source: When creating a project, click on “Options” and then on “Manage language resources”; a new window slides in from the right of your screen.
trans-unit.target: When creating a project, click on “Options” and then on “Manage language resources”; a new window slides in from the right of your screen.

trans-unit.source: Click on “+ Add a TM” to open up the box to add your TM (see below).
trans-unit.target: Click on “+ Add a TM” to open up the box to add your TM (see below).

trans-unit.source: You can do the same while translating: click on “Add your personal TM” and a new window slides in from the right of your screen.
trans-unit.target: You can do the same while translating: click on “Add your personal TM” and a new window slides in from the right of your screen.

trans-unit.source: Click on “+ Add a TM” to add your private TM.
trans-unit.target: Click on “+ Add a TM” to add your private TM.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a private key (that is, an alphanumeric string that identifies your private TM), you can paste it in the first input box, otherwise click on “Create”.
trans-unit.target: If you already have a private key (that is, an alphanumeric string that identifies your private TM), you can paste it in the first input box, otherwise click on “Create”.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can enter a short description to help you remember what the TM is for (e.g.{j}“ACME bird seeds”).
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can enter a short description to help you remember what the TM is for (e.g.{j}“ACME bird seeds”).

trans-unit.source: When you are done, click on “Confirm” and your private TM is created.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, click on “Confirm” and your private TM is created.

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 31
trans-unit.target: Page 31

trans-unit.source: {b>Importing your TMX files<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Importing your TMX files<b}

trans-unit.source: After you create a private TM as described above, you can import your TMX{1>6 <1}{2>files into it to re-use your previously translated content.<2}
trans-unit.target: After you create a private TM as described above, you can import your TMX{1>6 <1}{2>files into it to re-use your previously translated content.<2}

trans-unit.source: To import a TMX to your private TM, click on “Import TMX”, select the TMX file to import and confirm.
trans-unit.target: To import a TMX to your private TM, click on “Import TMX”, select the TMX file to import and confirm.

trans-unit.source: Note that a private TM on MateCat can contain any number of languages, so you can put all languages in a single private TM for a client, product, subject or whatever is more convenient for you.
trans-unit.target: Note that a private TM on MateCat can contain any number of languages, so you can put all languages in a single private TM for a client, product, subject or whatever is more convenient for you.

trans-unit.source: {b>Active and Inactive TMs<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Active and Inactive TMs<b}

trans-unit.source: In your Language resources panel you will see two separate lists:
trans-unit.target: In your Language resources panel you will see two separate lists:

trans-unit.source: • {1>Active TMs are the translation memories that you have assigned to the project you are creating or to the project you are working on;<1}
trans-unit.target: • {1>Active TMs are the translation memories that you have assigned to the project you are creating or to the project you are working on;<1}

trans-unit.source: • {1>Inactive TMs are the translation memories that you have saved in your profile on MateCat and that you can add to a project by selecting the “Lookup” checkbox and/or “Update”.<1}
trans-unit.target: • {1>Inactive TMs are the translation memories that you have saved in your profile on MateCat and that you can add to a project by selecting the “Lookup” checkbox and/or “Update”.<1}

trans-unit.source: You can activate a TM by selecting the Lookup or Update checkbox.
trans-unit.target: You can activate a TM by selecting the Lookup or Update checkbox.

trans-unit.source: 6 {1>TMX is one of the most common translation memory formats.<1}
trans-unit.target: 6 {1>TMX is one of the most common translation memory formats.<1}

trans-unit.source: {1>It is the main translation exchange format.<1}
trans-unit.target: {1>It is the main translation exchange format.<1}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 32
trans-unit.target: Page 32

trans-unit.source: {b>Look up and Update<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Look up and Update<b}

trans-unit.source: For any TM, you can decide whether you want to use it to look up translation matches or to also save your translations to it.
trans-unit.target: For any TM, you can decide whether you want to use it to look up translation matches or to also save your translations to it.

trans-unit.source: To do that, select one or both of the “Lookup” and “Update” checkboxes.
trans-unit.target: To do that, select one or both of the “Lookup” and “Update” checkboxes.

trans-unit.source: • {1>Only “Lookup” selected: the translation memory is only used to look up translation matches from your private TM;<1}
trans-unit.target: • {1>Only “Lookup” selected: the translation memory is only used to look up translation matches from your private TM;<1}

trans-unit.source: • {1>Only “Update” selected: the translation memory is only used to save your translated segments in the private TM;<1}
trans-unit.target: • {1>Only “Update” selected: the translation memory is only used to save your translated segments in the private TM;<1}

trans-unit.source: • {1>Both “Lookup” and “Update” selected: the translation memory is used both to look up translation matches and to save your translated segments in the private TM.<1}
trans-unit.target: • {1>Both “Lookup” and “Update” selected: the translation memory is used both to look up translation matches and to save your translated segments in the private TM.<1}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 33
trans-unit.target: Page 33

trans-unit.source: {b>Adding multiple private TMs to your project<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Adding multiple private TMs to your project<b}

trans-unit.source: You can add any number of private TMs to your project.
trans-unit.target: You can add any number of private TMs to your project.

trans-unit.source: When you add more than one private TM to your project, you can order them by dragging and dropping each TM to the desired position.
trans-unit.target: When you add more than one private TM to your project, you can order them by dragging and dropping each TM to the desired position.

trans-unit.source: The translation matches that MateCat presents for each segment are ranked based on their fuzzy match score.
trans-unit.target: The translation matches that MateCat presents for each segment are ranked based on their fuzzy match score.

trans-unit.source: However, when two matches coming from two different TMs have the same fuzzy match score, they are ranked based on the priority of the private TMs in your “Active TM” list.
trans-unit.target: However, when two matches coming from two different TMs have the same fuzzy match score, they are ranked based on the priority of the private TMs in your “Active TM” list.

trans-unit.source: {b>Private TMs from other users<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Private TMs from other users<b}

trans-unit.source: When you are working on a project created by another user (e.g. your PM) or you are working with a colleague, you may see translation memories that do not belong to you: they are greyed out and covered with asterisks.
trans-unit.target: When you are working on a project created by another user (e.g. your PM) or you are working with a colleague, you may see translation memories that do not belong to you: they are greyed out and covered with asterisks.

trans-unit.source: These are private TMs that another user added to the project and chose to share with you.
trans-unit.target: These are private TMs that another user added to the project and chose to share with you.

trans-unit.source: Only the owner of those TMs can decide whether to add them to a project or to make them available to you in “Lookup” and/or “Update” mode.
trans-unit.target: Only the owner of those TMs can decide whether to add them to a project or to make them available to you in “Lookup” and/or “Update” mode.

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 34
trans-unit.target: Page 34

trans-unit.source: {b>Sharing your private TMs<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Sharing your private TMs<b}

trans-unit.source: You can share your private TMs with other users simply by sending them the private key (e.g. 89e877998c9dae5a5337).
trans-unit.target: You can share your private TMs with other users simply by sending them the private key (e.g. 89e877998c9dae5a5337).

trans-unit.source: All they will need to do is to copy and paste the private TM into the private key input box that is opened when clicking on “+ Add a TM”.
trans-unit.target: All they will need to do is to copy and paste the private TM into the private key input box that is opened when clicking on “+ Add a TM”.

trans-unit.source: {1}Note:
trans-unit.target: {1}Note:

trans-unit.source: When you share a private key, you are in fact giving full access to that translation memory.
trans-unit.target: When you share a private key, you are in fact giving full access to that translation memory.

trans-unit.source: Users with your private key can use the private TM for their projects, update it and even delete it.
trans-unit.target: Users with your private key can use the private TM for their projects, update it and even delete it.

trans-unit.source: Working Offline
trans-unit.target: Working Offline

trans-unit.source: MateCat is designed for users that have access to the internet.
trans-unit.target: MateCat is designed for users that have access to the internet.

trans-unit.source: However, if you need to work offline on a project that you started with MateCat, you can export it from MateCat and continue with a desktop CAT tool.
trans-unit.target: However, if you need to work offline on a project that you started with MateCat, you can export it from MateCat and continue with a desktop CAT tool.

trans-unit.source: Access the {1>{2>Manage panel<2}{3>, <3}<1}{4>and click on Export SDLXLIFF, open the file with a CAT tool that supports this format (SDL Trados, MemoQ, OmegaT and many more).<4}
trans-unit.target: Access the {1>{2>Manage panel<2}{3>, <3}<1}{4>and click on Export SDLXLIFF, open the file with a CAT tool that supports this format (SDL Trados, MemoQ, OmegaT and many more).<4}

trans-unit.source: You can also use the Export feature to perform external QA checks with software such as ApSIC Xbench or Verifika.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the Export feature to perform external QA checks with software such as ApSIC Xbench or Verifika.

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 35
trans-unit.target: Page 35

trans-unit.source: Using TM matches, MT suggestions and Glossary terms
trans-unit.target: Using TM matches, MT suggestions and Glossary terms

trans-unit.source: When you open a segment for translation it will automatically populate with the first TM/MT match available for that segment.
trans-unit.target: When you open a segment for translation it will automatically populate with the first TM/MT match available for that segment.

trans-unit.source: You will receive {1>TM suggestions <1}if you add a {2>private TM key<2} to the project or in the case of fuzzy matches found in the {3>public translation memory<3}.
trans-unit.target: You will receive {1>TM suggestions <1}if you add a {2>private TM key<2} to the project or in the case of fuzzy matches found in the {3>public translation memory<3}.

trans-unit.source: They will be displayed as first suggestions just below the segment, under the {4>Translation matches <4}tab.
trans-unit.target: They will be displayed as first suggestions just below the segment, under the {4>Translation matches <4}tab.

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>If you have a personal translation memory, you can <2}{3>add it to the project<3}{4>.<4}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>If you have a personal translation memory, you can <2}{3>add it to the project<3}{4>.<4}

trans-unit.source: {4>Please refer to the <4}{5>Manage your language resources<5}{6> section<6}{7>.<7}
trans-unit.target: {4>Please refer to the <4}{5>Manage your language resources<5}{6> section<6}{7>.<7}

trans-unit.source: On the right, the tool gives information about the {1>source of the match<1}, the {2>creation date <2}and the {3>match percentage<3}, as shown in the screenshot below:
trans-unit.target: On the right, the tool gives information about the {1>source of the match<1}, the {2>creation date <2}and the {3>match percentage<3}, as shown in the screenshot below:

trans-unit.source: In this example, we have:
trans-unit.target: In this example, we have:

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 36
trans-unit.target: Page 36

trans-unit.source: If you have a {1>100% match <1}{2>from the TM.<2}
trans-unit.target: If you have a {1>100% match <1}{2>from the TM.<2}

trans-unit.source: If it is a {1>MT <1}{2>suggestion.<2}
trans-unit.target: If it is a {1>MT <1}{2>suggestion.<2}

trans-unit.source: The corresponding match percentage in case of a {1>fuzzy match <1}{2>from the TM.<2}
trans-unit.target: The corresponding match percentage in case of a {1>fuzzy match <1}{2>from the TM.<2}

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}a {2>100% match <2}in the {3>private TM key<3} that we added to the project (the private TM key is shown as the {4>source <4}{5>of the suggestion) for the first suggestion; the segment is therefore automatically populated with this suggestion.<5}
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}a {2>100% match <2}in the {3>private TM key<3} that we added to the project (the private TM key is shown as the {4>source <4}{5>of the suggestion) for the first suggestion; the segment is therefore automatically populated with this suggestion.<5}

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>When you add a private TM to your project, MateCat automatically associates a <2}{3>name <3}{4>with the private TM key in order to recognise the source of the suggestion while translat-ing.<4}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>When you add a private TM to your project, MateCat automatically associates a <2}{3>name <3}{4>with the private TM key in order to recognise the source of the suggestion while translat-ing.<4}

trans-unit.source: {4>It has the MyMemory_XXXX format, where XXXX is a <4}{5>unique alphanumeric value <5}{6>for each private TM key.<6}
trans-unit.target: {4>It has the MyMemory_XXXX format, where XXXX is a <4}{5>unique alphanumeric value <5}{6>for each private TM key.<6}

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}an {2>86% match <2}from the public TM (in this case the {3>source <3}{4>is “anonymous”) for the second suggestion<4}
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}an {2>86% match <2}from the public TM (in this case the {3>source <3}{4>is “anonymous”) for the second suggestion<4}

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}the {2>machine Translation suggestion <2}(the label of the source of the suggestion is {3>MT<3}) for the third suggestion.
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}the {2>machine Translation suggestion <2}(the label of the source of the suggestion is {3>MT<3}) for the third suggestion.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the source of the match and on the match percentage, the following labels will be displayed:
trans-unit.target: Depending on the source of the match and on the match percentage, the following labels will be displayed:

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 37
trans-unit.target: Page 37

trans-unit.source: {1>If you are taking part in a <1}{2>collaborative project<2}, you can also receive {3>real time suggestions <3}from the other translators working on the same project.
trans-unit.target: {1>If you are taking part in a <1}{2>collaborative project<2}, you can also receive {3>real time suggestions <3}from the other translators working on the same project.

trans-unit.source: This means that if more than one translator is working on the same project because it has been split among {4>several translators<4}, these translators share a private TM key and each of them receives suggestions for segments already translated within the same project.
trans-unit.target: This means that if more than one translator is working on the same project because it has been split among {4>several translators<4}, these translators share a private TM key and each of them receives suggestions for segments already translated within the same project.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the source of the suggestion will have the name of the {5>shared <5}{6>private<6} {7>TM key<7}.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the source of the suggestion will have the name of the {5>shared <5}{6>private<6} {7>TM key<7}.

trans-unit.source: You will see the suggestions ranked from the highest percentage of matching to the lowest.
trans-unit.target: You will see the suggestions ranked from the highest percentage of matching to the lowest.

trans-unit.source: The MT suggestions correspond to an {1>85% match by default<1}.
trans-unit.target: The MT suggestions correspond to an {1>85% match by default<1}.

trans-unit.source: If there are no higher percentages of matching, you will see the MT as the first suggestion.
trans-unit.target: If there are no higher percentages of matching, you will see the MT as the first suggestion.

trans-unit.source: To {1>select and enter one of the suggestions <1}into the translation input field you can:
trans-unit.target: To {1>select and enter one of the suggestions <1}into the translation input field you can:

trans-unit.source: • {1>Use the <1}{2>shortcut <2}{3>ALT+CTRL+[n] for Windows or ALT+CMD+[n] for Mac OS X where [n] could be 1, 2 or 3, depending on whether you would like to add respectively the first, second or third suggestion.<3}
trans-unit.target: • {1>Use the <1}{2>shortcut <2}{3>ALT+CTRL+[n] for Windows or ALT+CMD+[n] for Mac OS X where [n] could be 1, 2 or 3, depending on whether you would like to add respectively the first, second or third suggestion.<3}

trans-unit.source: • {1>double-click on the match <1}{2>you would like to select<2}
trans-unit.target: • {1>double-click on the match <1}{2>you would like to select<2}

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>If you hover over a TM match, a <2}{3>dustbin icon<3}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>If you hover over a TM match, a <2}{3>dustbin icon<3}

trans-unit.source: {4>appears on the right.<4}
trans-unit.target: {4>appears on the right.<4}

trans-unit.source: {4>Click on it to <4}{5>remove the TM match from the translation memory<5}{6>.<6}
trans-unit.target: {4>Click on it to <4}{5>remove the TM match from the translation memory<5}{6>.<6}

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>Note: click on the dustbin icon only if you would like to <2}{3>delete the match from the translation memory <3}{4>because the target text is not the correct translation of the source text.<4}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>Note: click on the dustbin icon only if you would like to <2}{3>delete the match from the translation memory <3}{4>because the target text is not the correct translation of the source text.<4}

trans-unit.source: {5>Do not delete it if you think it is not the correct suggestion for the segment you are translating<5}{6>.<6}
trans-unit.target: {5>Do not delete it if you think it is not the correct suggestion for the segment you are translating<5}{6>.<6}

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>If you would like to <2}{3>copy the source segment to the target input area<3}{4>, click on the arrow between the source and target segment<4}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>If you would like to <2}{3>copy the source segment to the target input area<3}{4>, click on the arrow between the source and target segment<4}

trans-unit.source: {4>or press ALT+CTRL+I<4}
trans-unit.target: {4>or press ALT+CTRL+I<4}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 38
trans-unit.target: Page 38

trans-unit.source: How to Use Glossary Terms in Your Translated Segment
trans-unit.target: How to Use Glossary Terms in Your Translated Segment

trans-unit.source: The {1>Glossary<1}{2> tab provides <2}{3>suggestions from the glossary <3}previously included in the {4>private TM key<4}{5> which is associated with the project.<5}
trans-unit.target: The {1>Glossary<1}{2> tab provides <2}{3>suggestions from the glossary <3}previously included in the {4>private TM key<4}{5> which is associated with the project.<5}

trans-unit.source: Every time you encounter this term in the text, it is displayed by the glossary and the {1>term in the segments underlined<1}, as shown in the screenshot below:
trans-unit.target: Every time you encounter this term in the text, it is displayed by the glossary and the {1>term in the segments underlined<1}, as shown in the screenshot below:

trans-unit.source: The translations of these terms are listed under the {1>Glossary tab <1}{2>which indicates in brackets the number of terms in the segment found in the glossary.<2}
trans-unit.target: The translations of these terms are listed under the {1>Glossary tab <1}{2>which indicates in brackets the number of terms in the segment found in the glossary.<2}

trans-unit.source: Each glossary suggestion also gives information about the {1>source of the translation <1}and the {2>creation date<2}.
trans-unit.target: Each glossary suggestion also gives information about the {1>source of the translation <1}and the {2>creation date<2}.

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>If you hover over a suggested term, a <2}{3>dustbin icon<3}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>If you hover over a suggested term, a <2}{3>dustbin icon<3}

trans-unit.source: {4>appears on the right.<4}
trans-unit.target: {4>appears on the right.<4}

trans-unit.source: {4>Click on it to <4}{5>remove the term from the glossary<5}{6>.<6}
trans-unit.target: {4>Click on it to <4}{5>remove the term from the glossary<5}{6>.<6}

trans-unit.source: You can also {1>add new terms <1}to the glossary:
trans-unit.target: You can also {1>add new terms <1}to the glossary:

trans-unit.source: • {1>Add source and target terms in the corresponding windows<1}
trans-unit.target: • {1>Add source and target terms in the corresponding windows<1}

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}Add comments, if needed, by clicking on the {2>(+) Comment <2}button
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}Add comments, if needed, by clicking on the {2>(+) Comment <2}button

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 39
trans-unit.target: Page 39

trans-unit.source: {3>button to add the term to the glossary<3}
trans-unit.target: {3>button to add the term to the glossary<3}

trans-unit.source: {2>If no glossary is added to the project, you <2}{3>create your own new glossary <3}{4>by creating a new term, and, if no <4}{5>private TM key<5}{6> had been previously associated with the project, a <6}{7>new private TM key will be generated automatically <7}{8>and added to the project.<8}
trans-unit.target: {2>If no glossary is added to the project, you <2}{3>create your own new glossary <3}{4>by creating a new term, and, if no <4}{5>private TM key<5}{6> had been previously associated with the project, a <6}{7>new private TM key will be generated automatically <7}{8>and added to the project.<8}

trans-unit.source: Working with Text and Tags
trans-unit.target: Working with Text and Tags

trans-unit.source: o {1>Tag autocompletion<1}
trans-unit.target: o {1>Tag autocompletion<1}

trans-unit.source: When you need to input a tag into your translation, enter the symbol < and a list of the tags in the source text is displayed.
trans-unit.target: When you need to input a tag into your translation, enter the symbol < and a list of the tags in the source text is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Select the one you need and click Enter to add it to your translation.
trans-unit.target: Select the one you need and click Enter to add it to your translation.

trans-unit.source: o {1>Formatting features<1}
trans-unit.target: o {1>Formatting features<1}

trans-unit.source: MateCat uses a simple functionality to {1>change the case of words <1}{2>in the editing area.<2}
trans-unit.target: MateCat uses a simple functionality to {1>change the case of words <1}{2>in the editing area.<2}

trans-unit.source: {2>Just select one or more words and <2}{3>three buttons <3}will appear to allow you to select the formatting you want and switch the case ({4>upper case<4}, {5>lower case <5}and {6>capitalise first letter<6}{7>).<7}
trans-unit.target: {2>Just select one or more words and <2}{3>three buttons <3}will appear to allow you to select the formatting you want and switch the case ({4>upper case<4}, {5>lower case <5}and {6>capitalise first letter<6}{7>).<7}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 40
trans-unit.target: Page 40

trans-unit.source: o {1>Adding line breaks and hidden text<1}
trans-unit.target: o {1>Adding line breaks and hidden text<1}

trans-unit.source: If you need to add {1>line breaks <1}{2>in the target segment:<2}
trans-unit.target: If you need to add {1>line breaks <1}{2>in the target segment:<2}

trans-unit.source: • {1>place your cursor where you want the text to break to a new line,<1}
trans-unit.target: • {1>place your cursor where you want the text to break to a new line,<1}

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}press {2>Shift+Enter <2}and the segment will divide into two separate lines.
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}press {2>Shift+Enter <2}and the segment will divide into two separate lines.

trans-unit.source: The same number of lines will also be retained in the target document.
trans-unit.target: The same number of lines will also be retained in the target document.

trans-unit.source: MateCat uses {1>symbols for hidden characters <1}such as {2>tabs<2}, {3>non-breaking spaces <3}and
trans-unit.target: MateCat uses {1>symbols for hidden characters <1}such as {2>tabs<2}, {3>non-breaking spaces <3}and

trans-unit.source: {1}{2}{3}{4>line breaks<4}{5>, which are respectively<5}

trans-unit.source: {5>If one of them is present in the source text, you must reproduce it in the target segment using the corresponding key or <5}{6>shortcut<6}{7> (the Tab key on your keyboard to add a tab, the Shift+Enter shortcut to add a line break and Ctrl+Shift+Space shortcut to add a non-breaking space).<7}
